author: Staff Reporter
text:
Thanks to an effective investigation by police, says SP

Effective investigation helped the police detect 78 per cent of total cases reported in 2015. Recovery of stolen property was 82 per cent, said Superintendent of Police A. Saravanan.

Briefing on crime detection and performance of police in 2015, he said that four murder-for-gain cases and seven major decoity cases were detected, accused nabbed and properties worth Rs.3.95 crore recovered from them.

Thirty out of 42 waylaying cases registered last year were also detected. Dindigul district registered 57 murder cases last year when compared to 60 in 2014.

Crime rate had come down last year when compared to 2014 owing to an effective nocturnal surveillance and also round-the-clock patrolling. Stern action had been initiated against criminals to contain their activities.

About 81 habitual offenders were detained under the Goondas Act when compared to 31 in 2014, he added.

With effective road safety measures, the traffic police had registered 15.51 lakh cases against traffic violation and collected fine of Rs.1.51 crore from persons who violated traffic rules.

Similarly, 4.375 cases filed against drunk driving, 75,348 cases against two-wheeler riders who failed to wear helmets.

Registering of ganja smuggling cases was increased to 210 when compared to 76 cases and boot-leggers cases to 3,410 which was just 2,657 cases in 2014.
title: Crime detection 78 per cent in Dindigul district
